citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of the Interior, Fish and Wildlife Service
citeinfo.title: WETLANDS_PROJECTMETADATA_NWI_USFWS_IN: Boundaries of the Wetland Mapping Projects used by the National Wetland Inventory (NWI) in Indiana (U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service, Polygon Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit:
This layer was downloaded on October 20, 2014 from the following Web page of the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service (USFWS): [ http://www.fws.gov/wetlands/Data/State-Downloads.html ].
For the latest news from the USFWS please access the home page using the following link: [ http://www.fws.gov/wetlands/index.html ].
To access the online metadata documents for the data use the following link: [ http://www.fws.gov/wetlands/Data/metadata.html ].
The following is excerpted from the "Wetlands Product Summary" Web page of the USFWS:
"As of May of 2014, the wetland geospatial data layer provides on-line map information for all of the conterminous U.S., Hawaii, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the major Northern Mariana Islands and 35% of Alaska. This has been accomplished by working with numerous public and private cooperators to produce maps, digital data, and publications. Currently, efforts are underway to complete and maintain a seamless digital wetlands data set for the Nation. This effort constitutes the Wetlands Data Layer of the National Spatial Data Infrastructure."

descript.abstract:
WETLANDS_PROJECTMETADATA_NWI_USFWS_IN.SHP provides the extent, status, and location of National Wetland Inventory (NWI) wetland mapping projects.
The following is excerpted from metadata provided by the USFWS for the National Wetlands Inventory data:
"This data set represents the extent, status, and location of National Wetland Inventory wetland mapping projects. Each project polygon contains information on the type and date of imagery used to map the wetlands and a link to a document about specific mapping techniques and habitat information for that project."
descript.purpose:
The following is excerpted from metadata provided by the USFWS for the National Wetlands Inventory data:
"The present goal of the Service is to provide the citizens of the United States and its Trust Territories with current geospatially referenced information on the status and extent of wetland mapping projects."
descript.supplinf:
The following is excerpted from metadata provided by the USFWS for the National Wetlands Inventory data:
"This dataset was created to be used as auxillary information to the National Wetlands Inventory - Wetlands polygon dataset. Although this Federal Geographic Data Committee-compliant metadata file is intended to document the data set in nonproprietary form, as well as in Arc/INFO format, this metadata file may include some Arc/INFO-specific terminology."

idinfo.native: Esri ArcGIS version 10.2 shapefile format, approximately 492 Kb

attracc.attraccr:
The following is excerpted from metadata provided by the USFWS for the National Wetlands Inventory data:
"The source data was checked using standard review procedures. Attributes were checked by using visual inspection as well as automated verification routines. Quality of the attribute information varies with age and mapping protocols used when individual maps were prepared"

dataqual.logic:
The following is excerpted from metadata provided by the USFWS for the National Wetlands Inventory data:
"Polygon and chain-node topology are present. Every polygon has a label."
dataqual.complete:
The following is excerpted from metadata provided by the USFWS for the National Wetlands Inventory data:
"Topical overlay showing the extent, status and location of current NWI wetland mapping projects. Wetlands or other mapped features may have changed since the date or the imagery and/or field work. There may be occasional differences in polygon boundaries or classifications between the information depicted on the map and the actual conditions on site."

horizpa.horizpar:
The following is excerpted from metadata provided by the USFWS for the National Wetlands Inventory data:
"Horizontal positional accuracy was checked by using visual inspection, but varies with age and mapping protocols used when individual maps were prepared"

vertacc.vertaccr: Vertical positional accuracy is not a factor in the production or use of these data.

citeinfo.title: IN_SHAPEFILE_WETLANDS_PROJECTMETADATA.SHP: National Wetlands Inventory (NWI) Project Metadata (downloaded from USFWS)

srcinfo.srccontr: IN_SHAPEFILE_WETLANDS_PROJECTMETADATA.SHP was downloaded by IGS personnel on October 20, 2014 to update the wetlands information for Indiana, and was obtained from the following URL: http://www.fws.gov/wetlands/Data/State-Downloads.html

procstep.procdesc: Personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) downloaded an ESRI shapefile named "IN_SHAPEFILE_WETLANDS_PROJECTMETADATA" on October 20, 2014, from the following URL: [ http://www.fws.gov/wetlands/Data/State-Downloads.html ]. It was opened in Esri ArcCatalog and examined for completeness, and was then renamed "WETLANDS_PROJECTMETADATA_NWI_USFWS_IN.SHP" to follow internal naming conventions of the IGS. WETLANDS_PROJECTMETADATA_NWI_USFWS_IN.SHP was then re-projected using ArcCatalog, from the original "NAD_1983_Albers" coordinate system to the "NAD_1983_UTM_Zone_16N" coordinate system. It should also be noted that portions of the metadata provided with the source data were used to construct the metadata document for WETLANDS_PROJECTMETADATA_NWI_USFWS_IN.SHP.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit. v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Name of the wetland mapping project.
Current status of the wetland mapping project.

edom.edomvd: Represents a project/area where digital mapping has been conducted. Digital data exists for this area, and is included on Wetlands Mapper for public access.

attr.attrdef: Hyperlink URL to the Supplemental Map Information document related to the project area.
Hyperlink URL to FGDC metadata for the Wetlands dataset related to the project area.
Name of the organization who created the wetlands data related to the project area.
Calendar year for the most recent date of the imagery used for wetland delineation related to the project area.
Calendar date (format is MM/YY and/or MM/YYYY) for the most recent date of the imagery used for wetland delineation related to the project area.

The best image scale used for wetland delineation represented by RF scale value or by a generalization of ground resolution, (0 = unknown, 1 = < or equal to 1 meter but greater than 0, 2 = < or equal to 2 meters but greater than 1 meter, 3 = < or equal to 3 meters but greater than 2 meters).
All scales or resolutions of the imagery used for delineating the wetlands related to the project area.
Emulsion type of the imagery used for delineating the wetlands related to the project area.
General comments relating to the mapping project relating to the wetlands in the project area.

The best imagery emulsion type from all the types used to delineate the wetlands for a given project area. The order of hierarchy from best to worst is 'CIR' for Color Infrared, 'TC' for Natural or True color, 'BW' for Black and White, and 'Unknown'.
Perimeter of wetland mapping project polygon (units = meters)
Area of the wetland mapping project polygon (Units = sq. meters)

distinfo.distliab:
The following is excerpted from metadata provided by the USFWS for the National Wetlands Inventory data:
"Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service in the use of these data."
CREDIT (IGS)
Acknowledgment of the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service would be appreciated in products derived from these data. It is also requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data set. The following source citation should be included: [WETLANDS_PROJECTMETADATA_NWI_USFWS_IN: Boundaries of the Wetland Mapping Projects used by the National Wetland Inventory (NWI) in Indiana (U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service, Polygon Shapefile), 20141020].
WARRANTY (IGS)
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405 2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY (IGS)
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
